      • write2file

        public static void write2file(java.lang.String text,
                              java.io.File file,
                              boolean append)
        Used to write the @text to a file @file. If @append is TRUE, the @text is appended to the @file, otherwise the file is rewritten.
        Parameters:
        text - - text that will be written in the file
        file - - the system-dependent file name
        append - - if true, then bytes will be written to the end of the file rather than the beginning

      • readModuleXML

        public static java.util.List<Module> readModuleXML(java.lang.String file,
                                                   AllModules allModules,
                                                   AllTypes allTypes)
        Updates the list of All Modules by annotating the existing ones (or adding non-existing) using the I/O Types from the @file. Returns the list of Updated Modules.
        Parameters:
        file - - path to the .XML file containing tool annotations
        allModules - - list of all existing modules
        allTypes - - list of all existing types
        Returns:
        the list of all annotated Modules in the process (possibly empty list)

      • readModuleJson

        public static java.util.List<Module> readModuleJson(java.lang.String file,
                                                    AllModules allModules,
                                                    AllTypes allTypes)
        Updates the list of All Modules by annotating the existing ones (or adding non-existing) using the I/O Types from the @file. Returns the list of Updated Modules.
        Parameters:
        file - - path to the .json file containing tool annotations
        allModules - - list of all existing modules
        allTypes - - list of all existing types
        Returns:
        the list of all annotated Modules in the process (possibly empty list)

      • getListFromXML

        public static java.util.List<org.dom4j.Node> getListFromXML(java.lang.String xmlPath,
                                                            java.lang.String rootXMLpath)
        Get List of nodes that correspond to the elements of the structured XML file.
        Parameters:
        xmlPath - - path to the XML file
        rootXMLpath - - root structure of the elements within the path.
        Returns:
        List of Node elements of the XML.

      • getListFromJson

        public static java.util.List<org.json.JSONObject> getListFromJson(java.lang.String jsonPath,
                                                                  java.lang.String key)
        The method return a list of JSONObject elements that correspond to a given key in a Json file. If the key corresponds to a JSONArray all the elements are put in a List, otherwise if the key corresponds to a JSONObject list will contain only that object.
        Parameters:
        jsonPath - - path to the Json file
        key - - key label that corresponds to the elements
        Returns:
        List of elements that corresponds to the key. If the key does not exists returns empty list.

      • getListFromJson

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> getListFromJson(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject,
                                                    java.lang.String key,
                                                    java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        The method return a list of JSONObject elements that correspond to a given key in the given json object. If the key corresponds to a JSONArray all the elements are put in a List, otherwise if the key corresponds to a JSONObject list will contain only that object.
        Parameters:
        jsonObject - - Json object that is being explored
        key - - key label that corresponds to the elements
        clazz - - class to which the elements should belong to
        Returns:
        List of elements that corresponds to the key. If the key does not exists returns empty list.

      • isValidReadFile

        public static boolean isValidReadFile(java.lang.String path)
        Method checks whether the provided path corresponds to an existing file with required reading permissions.
        Parameters:
        path - - path to the file
        Returns:
        true if the file exists and can be read, false otherwise.

        Provide a safe interface for iteration trough a list.
        Type Parameters:
        E -
        Parameters:
        currList - - list that is being evaluated
        Returns:
        An empty list in case of currList == null, or currList otherwise.

      • safeGet

        public static <E> E safeGet(java.util.List<E> currList,
                            int index)
        Provide a safe interface for getting an element from the list. In order to bypass "index out of bounds" error.
        Parameters:
        currList - - list of elements
        index - - index of the element that is to be returned
        Returns:
        Element of the list, or null if the index is out of bounds.
